summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Daily Lieutenant's Log for August 10, 2019, documenting the shift activities and, most significantly, the medical emergency and death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg #76318-054). The log details the discovery of Epstein unresponsive in his cell, CPR attempts, and his transport to a hospital.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054 found unresponsive in cell Z06-220 on Unit 9 South at 6:33 AM; CPR performed and he was transported to a local hospital.

persons.name: Lt Anderson
persons.context: Was relieved of duty by the logging lieutenant at approximately 5:30 AM on the morning of August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Carreon-Macias
persons.context: Inmate #82858-198 released on bail bond at 3:59 PM on August 9, 2019, affecting the facility count.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220, Unit 9 South) at 6:33 AM. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, EMS arrived and continued CPR, and he was transported to a local hospital via ambulance.

events.title: Medical Emergency Response
events.description: A medical emergency was announced for Epstein. EMS arrived at 6:43 AM and BOP staff departed with him to the hospital at 7:10 AM, with CPR still in progress.

events.title: Inmate Transfer to Dry Cell
events.description: Inmate #86824-054 was transferred to a special housing dry cell at 3:58 PM.

events.title: Inmate Release on Bail
events.description: Inmate Carreon-Macias (#82858-198) was released on bail bond at 3:59 PM.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (Reg #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
The log records the precise timeline of the emergency response: CPR initiated, 911 called at 6:35 AM, EMS arrival at 6:43 AM, and hospital transport at 7:10 AM.
Epstein was housed in cell Z06-220 on Unit 9 South at the time he was found.
The log indicates multiple other inmates were on psychological observation or suicide watch with inmate companions in the days surrounding Epstein's death.
The document is an official Bureau of Prisons record detailing the operational activities and inmate count immediately before and during the incident.
